alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Dinwiddie and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 215 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Purdy, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... McKenney around 245 PM EDT. Dewitt around 300 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Warfield, Wharfs Store, Cherry Hill and Butterworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
